en: The Bel Air Distillery is more than a know-how: it is a passion for local aromatic plants and their distillation. We work slowly with the earth, at the rhythm of the seasons, respecting our soils, and also the animals that live there. Above or below, crawling or buzzing. We do not plow, we do not use fast machines, we plant trees. We act for the reactivation of biological systems and thus participate actively in the resilience of the Territories. This is practical agro-forestry. Because each plant is unique, we distill by nose, by feeling and touch, not by watch. To save water and energy, so precious, our tools are modified and our protocols refined. That's eco-design, nothing is lost. Once the distillation of a plant is finished, the materials emptied of their aromas begin a second life. Either in compost, mulch, bedding for goats or even insulation for eco-construction. That's the circular economyAll of our standard containers are made of glass, and we take back your used containers to recycle them. When you bring them back to us, you receive a discount on your purchase in exchange. We are happy to show you around our distillery and our fields for free. To be able to make you discover the details of the traditional distillation, from the field of flowers to the bottle of essential oil, it is to work for the recognition of the local productions of quality and it is to allow you to forge your own reference marks. It's also being committed. ðŸ“£ OPENING OF THE SHOP in St-JustFrom Tuesday, February 15, the store will be open 2 days a week: Tuesday and Wednesday from 11am to 6pm continuously.ðŸ“£ GUIDED TOURS ðŸŒŸ NEW / From Wednesday, February 16, a guided tour will be offered at 10am every Wednesday.Good news: no need to book!Duration 1h, rates on our websiteðŸŒŸ If you want to come and visit at another time, then it will be necessary to book by email: visite@belair.bioDurÃ©e 1h, rates on our website Discover the artisanal distillation and the cultivation of aromatic plants accompanied by a Guide from the Bel Air Distillery team!ðŸ“£ NEW / Discovery workshop on request Cousinade, family reunion, moment between friends ... We are listening to you to propose a fun and exciting dive into the world of essential oils! On reservationMin. 5 pers - max. 10 persDate & theme of your choice (subject to availability)Pets are allowed (dogs kept on a leash). Our market tour. Our store. Discover the Distillery Treat yourself to 5 â‚¬ of happiness in 1 click: subscribe to the Newsletter!

hasBeenPublishedBy.schema:logo: https://www.tourismegard.com/Portals/2/Market-place/Le portail des pros du tourisme du Gard_fichiers/logo-Gard-Tourisme.jpg

en:
The Bel Air Distillery is more than a know-how: it is a passion for local aromatic plants and their distillation.
We work slowly with the earth, at the rhythm of the seasons, respecting our soils, and also the animals that live there. Above or below, crawling or buzzing. We do not plow, we do not use fast machines, we plant trees. We act for the reactivation of biological systems and thus participate actively in the resilience of the Territories
This is practical agro-forestry.
Because each plant is unique, we distill by nose, by feeling and touch, not by watch. To save water and energy, so precious, our tools are modified and our protocols refined. That's what eco-design is all about.
Nothing is lost. Once the distillation of a plant is finished, the materials emptied of their aromas begin a second life. Either in compost, mulch, bedding for goats or even insulation for eco-construction
This is the circular economy
All of our standard containers are made of glass, and we take back your used containers to recycle them. When you bring them back to us, you receive a discount on your purchase in exchange
That's what producer responsibility is all about.

We are happy to show you around our distillery and our fields for free
To be able to show you the details of traditional distillation, from the flower field to the bottle of essential oil, is to work for the recognition of local quality production and to allow you to make your own references. It's also being committed.
ðŸ“£ OPENING OF THE SHOP in St-Just
From Tuesday, February 15, the store will be open 2 days a week: Tuesday and Wednesday from 11am to 6pm continuously.

ðŸ“£ GUIDED TOURS
ðŸŒŸ NEW / Starting Wednesday, February 16, a guided tour will be offered at 10am every Wednesday.
Good news: no need to reserve!
Duration 1 hour, rates on our website
ðŸŒŸ If you wish to come and visit at another time, then it will be necessary to reserve by email: visite@belair.bio
Duration 1h, prices on our website
Discover the artisanal distillation and the culture of aromatic plants accompanied by a Guide from the Bel Air Distillery team!

ðŸ“£ NEW / Discovery workshop on request
Cousinade, family reunion, moment between friends ... We are listening to you to propose a fun and exciting dive into the world of essential oils!
On reservation
Min. 5 people - max. 10 people
Date & theme of your choice (subject to availability)
Animals are allowed (dogs on a leash).

Our market tour.

Our store.

Discover the Distillery

Treat yourself to 5 â‚¬ of happiness in 1 click : subscribe to our Newsletter !
